text: Mafdet was a goddess in early Egyptian mythology. She protected against snakes and scorpions and was often shown as either some sort of feline or mongoose.Wilkinson, Richard H. The Complete Gods and Goddesses of Ancient Egypt. p. 196. Thames & Hudson. 2003. In art, Mafdet was shown as a feline, a woman with a feline head, or a feline with the head of a woman. ==References== Category:Egyptian gods and goddesses
title: Mafdet
